application_type_full: Outline planning permission: Some matters reserved
description:
The redevelopment for B1 use; including television
purposes  storage and parking.
decision_conditions:
Condition : 1 - The siting, design, external appearance of the building(s),
    the means of access thereto and the landscaping of the site
    ("the reserved matters") shall be approved by the Council
    before work on the site is commenced.

Condition : 2 - Application for approval of the reserved matters shall be
    submitted to the Council within three years from the date
    of this permission.

Condition : 3 - The total gross floor space shall not exceed 37,512m2 of
    which no more than 24,033 shall be above ground, without
    prior approval of the Council.

Condition : 4 - No loading or unloading of goods,including fuel, by
    vehicles arriving at or departing from the premises shall
    be carried out otherwise than within the curtilage of the
    building.

Condition : 5 - Details of access, with regard to contractor's vechicles
    and vans, during building operation, should be submitted to
    the Council before works commence.

Condition : 6 - Details of any plant/satellite receiving dishes shall be
    submitted to and approved by the Council before
    installation.

Condition : 7 - No process shall be carried on or machinery installed which
    is not such as could be carried on or installed in any
    residential area without detriment to the amenity of that
    area by reason of noise, vibration, smell, fumes, smoke,
    soot, ash, dust or grit.

Condition : 8 - That car parking provision shall not exceed the Council's
    standards as set out in The Environmental Code, unless
    otherwise agreed by the Council and shall be retained
    permanently for the parking of vehicles of the occupiers
    and users of the building 192-212 Gray's Inn Road.

Condition : 9 - Details of the provision for access for disabled persons in
    compliance with the provisions of S.4 of the Chronically
    Sick and Disabled Persons Act 1970, and the 1985 Building
    Regulations (as amended by The Building (Disabled People)
    Regulations 1987) shall not be otherwise than as shall have
    been approved by the Council before any work on the site is
    commenced.

Condition : 10 - In order that the Council may give consideration to the
    details of the proposed development.

Condition : 11 - In order to comply with the provisions of Section 92 of the
    Town and Country Planning Act 1990.
Condition : 12 - To ensure the development is implemented as permitted.

Condition : 13 - & 05. To avoid obstruction of the surrounding streets and
    to safeguard  amenities of adjacent premises.

Condition : 14 - In order that the Council may give consideration to this
    matter and minimise noise disturbance and other nuisances
    in the immediate area.

Condition : 15 - To safeguard the amenities of the adjoining premises and
    the area generally.

Condition : 16 - To ensure the permanent retention of the accommodation for
    parking purposes and to ensure that the use of the building
    does not add to traffic congestion.

Condition : 17 - In order to ensure compliance with the terms of the Act and
    Regulations.

Condition : 18 - 01Your attention is drawn to requirements of Section 4, 7
    advised to consult  the Council's Director of Environmental
    Health and Consumer Services,141 Euston Road, London, NW1
    2RH. or to seek prior approval under 61 of the Act if you
    anticipate any difficulty in carrying out constructionother
    than within normal working hours and by means that would
    minimisedisturbance to adjoining premises.
    and 8A of theChronically Sick and Disabled Persons Act 1970

    public will be admitted" should be madeaccessible to
    disabled people wherever practicable. Guidance isprovided
    in British Standard Institution Code of Practice
    BS558814/12/87 "Access for the Disabled to Buildings".
